   122→
   123→print_header "MCP Tools Setup for Claude Code CLI"
   124→print_color "$GREEN" "MCP Tools Path: $MCP_TOOLS_PATH"
   125→print_color "$GREEN" "Configuration Scope: $CONFIG_SCOPE"
   126→
   127→# Check prerequisites
   128→print_header "Checking Prerequisites"
   129→
   130→# Check for Claude Code CLI
   131→if ! command_exists claude; then
   132→    print_color "$RED" "✗ Claude Code CLI not found"
   133→    print_color "$YELLOW" "  Please install Claude Code CLI first"
   134→    print_color "$YELLOW" "  Visit: https://docs.anthropic.com/claude-code/installation"
   135→    exit 1
   136→else
   137→    print_color "$GREEN" "✓ Claude Code CLI found: $(claude --version 2>/dev/null || echo 'installed')"
   138→fi
   139→
   140→# Check for Python
   141→if ! command_exists python && ! command_exists python3; then
   142→    print_color "$RED" "✗ Python not found"
   143→    print_color "$YELLOW" "  Python 3.8+ is required for Python tools"
   144→    PYTHON_MISSING=true
   145→else
   146→    PYTHON_CMD=$(command_exists python3 && echo "python3" || echo "python")
   147→    print_color "$GREEN" "✓ Python found: $($PYTHON_CMD --version)"
   148→fi
   149→
   150→# Check for Node.js
   151→if ! command_exists node; then
   152→    print_color "$RED" "✗ Node.js not found"
   153→    print_color "$YELLOW" "  Node.js 18+ is required for TypeScript tools"
   154→    NODE_MISSING=true
   155→else
   156→    print_color "$GREEN" "✓ Node.js found: $(node --version)"
   157→fi
   158→
   159→# Load environment variables if file provided
   160→if [ -n "$ENV_FILE" ] && [ -f "$ENV_FILE" ]; then
   161→    print_header "Loading Environment Variables"
   162→    source "$ENV_FILE"
   163→    print_color "$GREEN" "✓ Loaded environment from $ENV_FILE"
   164→fi
   165→
   166→# Set scope flag for claude mcp add command
   167→case $CONFIG_SCOPE in
   168→    local)
   169→        SCOPE_FLAG="--local"
   170→        ;;
   171→    project)
   172→        SCOPE_FLAG="--project"
   173→        ;;
   174→    user|*)
   175→        SCOPE_FLAG="--user"
   176→        ;;
   177→esac
   178→
   179→# Arrays to track success/failure
   180→SUCCESSFUL_TOOLS=()
   181→FAILED_TOOLS=()
   182→
   183→# Function to add a tool
   184→add_tool() {
   185→    local name=$1
   186→    local command=$2
   187→    local path=$3
   188→    shift 3
   189→    local env_args=("$@")
   190→    
   191→    print_color "$YELLOW" "Adding $name..."
   192→    
   193→    # Check if tool file exists
   194→    if [ ! -f "$path" ]; then
   195→        print_color "$RED" "  ✗ Tool file not found: $path"
   196→        FAILED_TOOLS+=("$name (file not found)")
   197→        return 1
   198→    fi
   199→    
   200→    # Build the claude mcp add command
   201→    local cmd="claude mcp add $SCOPE_FLAG \"$name\" $command \"$path\""
   202→    
   203→    # Add environment variables if provided
   204→    for env_arg in "${env_args[@]}"; do
   205→        if [ -n "$env_arg" ]; then
   206→            cmd="$cmd --env \"$env_arg\""
   207→        fi
   208→    done
   209→    
   210→    # Execute the command
   211→    if eval "$cmd" 2>/dev/null; then
   212→        print_color "$GREEN" "  ✓ $name added successfully"
   213→        SUCCESSFUL_TOOLS+=("$name")
   214→        return 0
   215→    else
   216→        print_color "$RED" "  ✗ Failed to add $name"
   217→        FAILED_TOOLS+=("$name")
   218→        return 1
   219→    fi
   220→}
   221→
   222→# Python tools setup
   223→if [ -z "$PYTHON_MISSING" ]; then
   224→    print_header "Setting Up Python Tools"
   225→    
   226→    # Python tools configuration
   227→    declare -A PYTHON_TOOLS=(
   228→        ["fetch"]="fetch/server.py"
   229→        ["git"]="git/server.py"
   230→        ["ui-browser"]="ui-browser/server.py"
   231→        ["grafana"]="grafana/server.py"
   232→        ["redis"]="redis/src/server.py"
   233→    )
   234→    
   235→    for tool_name in "${!PYTHON_TOOLS[@]}"; do
   236→        tool_path="${PYTHON_TOOLS[$tool_name]}"
   237→        full_path="$MCP_TOOLS_PATH/$tool_path"
   238→        
   239→        # Check if virtual environment exists
   240→        tool_dir=$(dirname "$full_path")
   241→        if [ -d "$tool_dir/venv" ]; then
   242→            print_color "$BLUE" "  Found virtual environment for $tool_name"
   243→        elif [ -f "$tool_dir/requirements.txt" ]; then
   244→            print_color "$YELLOW" "  Warning: No virtual environment found for $tool_name"
   245→            print_color "$YELLOW" "  Consider running: cd $tool_dir && python -m venv venv && source venv/bin/activate && pip install -r requirements.txt"
   246→        fi
   247→        
   248→        # Tool-specific environment variables
   249→        case $tool_name in
   250→            fetch)
   251→                add_tool "$tool_name" "$PYTHON_CMD" "$full_path" \
   252→                    "MCP_FETCH_TIMEOUT=${MCP_FETCH_TIMEOUT:-30}" \
   253→                    "MCP_FETCH_MAX_RETRIES=${MCP_FETCH_MAX_RETRIES:-3}"
   254→                ;;
   255→            ui-browser)
   256→                add_tool "$tool_name" "$PYTHON_CMD" "$full_path" \
   257→                    "MCP_UI_BROWSER_HEADLESS=${MCP_UI_BROWSER_HEADLESS:-true}"
   258→                ;;
   259→            git)
   260→                add_tool "$tool_name" "$PYTHON_CMD" "$full_path" \
   261→                    "MCP_GIT_ALLOWED_REPOS=${MCP_GIT_ALLOWED_REPOS:-./}"
   262→                ;;
   263→            *)
   264→                add_tool "$tool_name" "$PYTHON_CMD" "$full_path"
   265→                ;;
   266→        esac
   267→    done
   268→fi
   269→
   270→# TypeScript tools setup
   271→if [ -z "$NODE_MISSING" ]; then
   272→    print_header "Setting Up TypeScript Tools"
   273→    
   274→    # TypeScript tools configuration
   275→    declare -A TS_TOOLS=(
   276→        ["memory"]="memory"
   277→        ["filesystem"]="filesystem"
   278→        ["sequential-thinking"]="sequential-thinking"
   279→        ["github"]="github"
   280→        ["react-assistant"]="react-assistant"
   281→        ["rest-api-tester"]="rest-api-tester"
   282→    )
   283→    
   284→    for tool_name in "${!TS_TOOLS[@]}"; do
   285→        tool_dir="${TS_TOOLS[$tool_name]}"
   286→        full_dir="$MCP_TOOLS_PATH/$tool_dir"
   287→        
   288→        if [ -d "$full_dir" ]; then
   289→            # Check if tool needs building
   290→            if [ "$BUILD_TS_TOOLS" = true ] || [ ! -f "$full_dir/dist/index.js" ]; then
   291→                print_color "$YELLOW" "Building $tool_name..."
   292→                (
   293→                    cd "$full_dir"
   294→                    if [ -f "package.json" ]; then
   295→                        npm install >/dev/null 2>&1
   296→                        npm run build >/dev/null 2>&1
   297→                        print_color "$GREEN" "  ✓ $tool_name built successfully"
   298→                    else
   299→                        print_color "$RED" "  ✗ No package.json found for $tool_name"
   300→                        FAILED_TOOLS+=("$tool_name (no package.json)")
   301→                        continue
   302→                    fi
   303→                ) || {
   304→                    print_color "$RED" "  ✗ Failed to build $tool_name"
   305→                    FAILED_TOOLS+=("$tool_name (build failed)")
   306→                    continue
   307→                }
   308→            fi
   309→            
   310→            # Tool-specific environment variables
   311→            case $tool_name in
   312→                memory)
   313→                    add_tool "$tool_name" "node" "$full_dir/dist/index.js" \
   314→                        "MCP_MEMORY_DB_PATH=${MCP_MEMORY_DB_PATH:-./.mcp-data/memory.db}" \
   315→                        "MCP_MEMORY_MAX_ENTITIES=${MCP_MEMORY_MAX_ENTITIES:-10000}"
   316→                    ;;
   317→                filesystem)
   318→                    add_tool "$tool_name" "node" "$full_dir/dist/index.js" \
   319→                        "MCP_FILESYSTEM_ALLOWED_DIRS=${MCP_FILESYSTEM_ALLOWED_DIRS:-./}"
   320→                    ;;
   321→                sequential-thinking)
   322→                    add_tool "$tool_name" "node" "$full_dir/dist/index.js" \
   323→                        "MCP_SEQUENTIAL_THINKING_STORAGE_PATH=${MCP_SEQUENTIAL_THINKING_STORAGE_PATH:-./.mcp-data/thinking}"
   324→                    ;;
   325→                *)
   326→                    add_tool "$tool_name" "node" "$full_dir/dist/index.js"
   327→                    ;;
   328→            esac
   329→        else
   330→            print_color "$RED" "  ✗ Directory not found: $full_dir"
   331→            FAILED_TOOLS+=("$tool_name (directory not found)")
   332→        fi
   333→    done
   334→fi
   335→
   336→# Verify installation
   337→print_header "Verifying Installation"
   338→
   339→# Get list of installed tools
   340→INSTALLED_TOOLS=$(claude mcp list 2>/dev/null | grep -E "^\s+" | sed 's/^[[:space:]]*//' | cut -d' ' -f1)
   341→
   342→if [ -n "$INSTALLED_TOOLS" ]; then
   343→    print_color "$GREEN" "Installed MCP Tools:"
   344→    echo "$INSTALLED_TOOLS" | while read -r tool; do
   345→        print_color "$GREEN" "  ✓ $tool"
   346→    done
   347→else
   348→    print_color "$YELLOW" "No tools currently installed"
   349→fi
   350→
   351→# Summary
   352→print_header "Setup Summary"
   353→
   354→if [ ${#SUCCESSFUL_TOOLS[@]} -gt 0 ]; then
   355→    print_color "$GREEN" "Successfully installed (${#SUCCESSFUL_TOOLS[@]} tools):"
   356→    for tool in "${SUCCESSFUL_TOOLS[@]}"; do
   357→        print_color "$GREEN" "  ✓ $tool"
   358→    done
   359→fi
   360→
   361→if [ ${#FAILED_TOOLS[@]} -gt 0 ]; then
   362→    print_color "$RED" "Failed to install (${#FAILED_TOOLS[@]} tools):"
   363→    for tool in "${FAILED_TOOLS[@]}"; do
   364→        print_color "$RED" "  ✗ $tool"
   365→    done
   366→fi
   367→
   368→# Create project configuration template
   369→print_header "Creating Project Configuration"
   370→
   371→PROJECT_CONFIG_DIR=".mcp-configs"
   372→if [ ! -d "$PROJECT_CONFIG_DIR" ]; then
   373→    mkdir -p "$PROJECT_CONFIG_DIR"
   374→    print_color "$GREEN" "✓ Created $PROJECT_CONFIG_DIR directory"
   375→fi
   376→
   377→# Create example environment file
   378→cat > "$PROJECT_CONFIG_DIR/example.env" << 'EOF'
   379→# MCP Tools Environment Variables
   380→# Copy this file to .env and customize for your project
   381→
   382→# Fetch Tool
   383→MCP_FETCH_TIMEOUT=30
   384→MCP_FETCH_MAX_RETRIES=3
   385→MCP_FETCH_USER_AGENT="MyProject/1.0"
   386→
   387→# Memory Tool
   388→MCP_MEMORY_DB_PATH="./.mcp-data/memory.db"
   389→MCP_MEMORY_MAX_ENTITIES=10000
   390→
   391→# Filesystem Tool
   392→MCP_FILESYSTEM_ALLOWED_DIRS="./"
   393→MCP_FILESYSTEM_MAX_FILE_SIZE=10485760
   394→
   395→# UI Browser Tool
   396→MCP_UI_BROWSER_HEADLESS=true
   397→MCP_UI_BROWSER_SCREENSHOT_DIR="./screenshots"
   398→
   399→# Git Tool
   400→MCP_GIT_ALLOWED_REPOS="./"
   401→MCP_GIT_MAX_COMMITS=100
   402→
   403→# Sequential Thinking Tool
   404→MCP_SEQUENTIAL_THINKING_STORAGE_PATH="./.mcp-data/thinking"
   405→MCP_SEQUENTIAL_THINKING_MAX_THINKING_STEPS=25
   406→EOF
   407→
   408→print_color "$GREEN" "✓ Created example environment file: $PROJECT_CONFIG_DIR/example.env"
   409→
   410→# Create tool test script
   411→cat > "$PROJECT_CONFIG_DIR/test-tools.sh" << 'EOF'
   412→#!/bin/bash
   413→
   414→# Test script for MCP Tools
   415→
   416→echo "Testing MCP Tools installation..."
   417→echo ""
   418→
   419→# Function to test if a tool is available
   420→test_tool() {
   421→    local tool_name=$1
   422→    echo -n "Testing $tool_name... "
   423→    
   424→    if claude mcp list 2>/dev/null | grep -q "$tool_name"; then
   425→        echo "✓ Available"
   426→        return 0
   427→    else
   428→        echo "✗ Not found"
   429→        return 1
   430→    fi
   431→}
   432→
   433→# Test each tool
   434→TOOLS=(fetch memory filesystem git ui-browser sequential-thinking github react-assistant rest-api-tester grafana redis)
   435→
   436→success=0
   437→failed=0
   438→
   439→for tool in "${TOOLS[@]}"; do
   440→    if test_tool "$tool"; then
   441→        ((success++))
   442→    else
   443→        ((failed++))
   444→    fi
   445→done
   446→
   447→echo ""
   448→echo "Summary: $success available, $failed not found"
   449→
   450→if [ $failed -eq 0 ]; then
   451→    echo "All tools are properly configured!"
   452→    exit 0
   453→else
   454→    echo "Some tools are missing. Run setup-claude-code-cli.sh to install them."
   455→    exit 1
   456→fi
   457→EOF
   458→
   459→chmod +x "$PROJECT_CONFIG_DIR/test-tools.sh"
   460→print_color "$GREEN" "✓ Created test script: $PROJECT_CONFIG_DIR/test-tools.sh"
   461→
   462→# Final instructions
   463→print_header "Next Steps"
   464→
   465→print_color "$BLUE" "1. Test your installation:"
   466→print_color "$NC" "   claude mcp list"
   467→print_color "$NC" "   ./$PROJECT_CONFIG_DIR/test-tools.sh"
   468→
   469→print_color "$BLUE" "2. Start using Claude Code with MCP tools:"
   470→print_color "$NC" "   claude code"
   471→
   472→print_color "$BLUE" "3. Customize environment variables:"
   473→print_color "$NC" "   cp $PROJECT_CONFIG_DIR/example.env .env"
   474→print_color "$NC" "   # Edit .env with your settings"
   475→print_color "$NC" "   source .env"
   476→
   477→print_color "$BLUE" "4. For project-specific configuration:"
   478→print_color "$NC" "   # Create .mcp-*.json files in your project root"
   479→print_color "$NC" "   # See docs/guides/claude_code_cli_setup.md for details"
   480→
   481→if [ ${#FAILED_TOOLS[@]} -gt 0 ]; then
   482→    echo ""
   483→    print_color "$YELLOW" "⚠ Some tools failed to install. Please check the errors above and:"
   484→    print_color "$NC" "  - Ensure all dependencies are installed"
   485→    print_color "$NC" "  - Check file paths are correct"
   486→    print_color "$NC" "  - Try running with --build flag to rebuild TypeScript tools"
   487→fi
   488→
   489→echo ""
   490→print_color "$GREEN" "Setup complete! Happy coding with Claude Code CLI and MCP Tools! 🚀"

#!/bin/bash

# ============================================================================
# MCP Tools Setup Script for Claude Code CLI
# ============================================================================
# This script automates the installation and configuration of MCP Tools
# for use with Claude Code CLI.
#
# Usage:
#   ./setup-claude-code-cli.sh [options]
#
# Options:
#   --path PATH     Path to MCP Tools directory (default: current directory)
#   --scope SCOPE   Configuration scope: local, project, or user (default: user)
#   --build         Build TypeScript tools before adding
#   --env-file FILE Load environment variables from file
#   --help          Show this help message
#
# ============================================================================

set -e

# Colors for output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Default values
MCP_TOOLS_PATH="$(pwd)"
CONFIG_SCOPE="user"
BUILD_TS_TOOLS=false
ENV_FILE=""

# Function to print colored output
print_color() {
    local color=$1
    shift
    echo -e "${color}$@${NC}"
}

# Function to print section headers
print_header() {
    echo ""
    print_color "$BLUE" "============================================"
    print_color "$BLUE" "$1"
    print_color "$BLUE" "============================================"
}

# Function to check if a command exists
command_exists() {
    command -v "$1" >/dev/null 2>&1
}

# Function to show help
show_help() {
    cat << EOF
MCP Tools Setup Script for Claude Code CLI

Usage:
  $0 [options]

Options:
  --path PATH     Path to MCP Tools directory (default: current directory)
  --scope SCOPE   Configuration scope: local, project, or user (default: user)
  --build         Build TypeScript tools before adding
  --env-file FILE Load environment variables from file
  --help          Show this help message

Examples:
  # Basic setup with default options
  $0

  # Setup with custom path and build TypeScript tools
  $0 --path /home/user/mcp-tools --build

  # Setup with project scope and environment file
  $0 --scope project --env-file .env.mcp

EOF
    exit 0
}

# Parse command line arguments
while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
    case $1 in
        --path)
            MCP_TOOLS_PATH="$2"
            shift 2
            ;;
        --scope)
            CONFIG_SCOPE="$2"
            shift 2
            ;;
        --build)
            BUILD_TS_TOOLS=true
            shift
            ;;
        --env-file)
            ENV_FILE="$2"
            shift 2
            ;;
        --help)
            show_help
            ;;
        *)
            print_color "$RED" "Unknown option: $1"
            show_help
            ;;
    esac
done

# Validate MCP Tools path
if [ ! -d "$MCP_TOOLS_PATH" ]; then
    print_color "$RED" "Error: MCP Tools directory not found at $MCP_TOOLS_PATH"
    exit 1
fi

# Make path absolute
MCP_TOOLS_PATH=$(cd "$MCP_TOOLS_PATH" && pwd)

print_header "MCP Tools Setup for Claude Code CLI"
print_color "$GREEN" "MCP Tools Path: $MCP_TOOLS_PATH"
print_color "$GREEN" "Configuration Scope: $CONFIG_SCOPE"

# Check prerequisites
print_header "Checking Prerequisites"

# Check for Claude Code CLI
if ! command_exists claude; then
    print_color "$RED" "✗ Claude Code CLI not found"
    print_color "$YELLOW" "  Please install Claude Code CLI first"
    print_color "$YELLOW" "  Visit: https://docs.anthropic.com/claude-code/installation"
    exit 1
else
    print_color "$GREEN" "✓ Claude Code CLI found: $(claude --version 2>/dev/null || echo 'installed')"
fi

# Check for Python
if ! command_exists python && ! command_exists python3; then
    print_color "$RED" "✗ Python not found"
    print_color "$YELLOW" "  Python 3.8+ is required for Python tools"
    PYTHON_MISSING=true
else
    PYTHON_CMD=$(command_exists python3 && echo "python3" || echo "python")
    print_color "$GREEN" "✓ Python found: $($PYTHON_CMD --version)"
fi

# Check for Node.js
if ! command_exists node; then
    print_color "$RED" "✗ Node.js not found"
    print_color "$YELLOW" "  Node.js 18+ is required for TypeScript tools"
    NODE_MISSING=true
else
    print_color "$GREEN" "✓ Node.js found: $(node --version)"
fi

# Load environment variables if file provided
if [ -n "$ENV_FILE" ] && [ -f "$ENV_FILE" ]; then
    print_header "Loading Environment Variables"
    source "$ENV_FILE"
    print_color "$GREEN" "✓ Loaded environment from $ENV_FILE"
fi

# Set scope flag for claude mcp add command
case $CONFIG_SCOPE in
    local)
        SCOPE_FLAG="--local"
        ;;
    project)
        SCOPE_FLAG="--project"
        ;;
    user|*)
        SCOPE_FLAG="--user"
        ;;
esac

# Arrays to track success/failure
SUCCESSFUL_TOOLS=()
FAILED_TOOLS=()

# Function to add a tool
add_tool() {
    local name=$1
    local command=$2
    local path=$3
    shift 3
    local env_args=("$@")
    
    print_color "$YELLOW" "Adding $name..."
    
    # Check if tool file exists
    if [ ! -f "$path" ]; then
        print_color "$RED" "  ✗ Tool file not found: $path"
        FAILED_TOOLS+=("$name (file not found)")
        return 1
    fi
    
    # Build the claude mcp add command
    local cmd="claude mcp add $SCOPE_FLAG \"$name\" $command \"$path\""
    
    # Add environment variables if provided
    for env_arg in "${env_args[@]}"; do
        if [ -n "$env_arg" ]; then
            cmd="$cmd --env \"$env_arg\""
        fi
    done
    
    # Execute the command
    if eval "$cmd" 2>/dev/null; then
        print_color "$GREEN" "  ✓ $name added successfully"
        SUCCESSFUL_TOOLS+=("$name")
        return 0
    else
        print_color "$RED" "  ✗ Failed to add $name"
        FAILED_TOOLS+=("$name")
        return 1
    fi
}

# Python tools setup
if [ -z "$PYTHON_MISSING" ]; then
    print_header "Setting Up Python Tools"
    
    # Python tools configuration
    declare -A PYTHON_TOOLS=(
        ["fetch"]="fetch/server.py"
        ["git"]="git/server.py"
        ["ui-browser"]="ui-browser/server.py"
        ["grafana"]="grafana/server.py"
        ["redis"]="redis/src/server.py"
    )
    
    for tool_name in "${!PYTHON_TOOLS[@]}"; do
        tool_path="${PYTHON_TOOLS[$tool_name]}"
        full_path="$MCP_TOOLS_PATH/$tool_path"
        
        # Check if virtual environment exists
        tool_dir=$(dirname "$full_path")
        if [ -d "$tool_dir/venv" ]; then
            print_color "$BLUE" "  Found virtual environment for $tool_name"
        elif [ -f "$tool_dir/requirements.txt" ]; then
            print_color "$YELLOW" "  Warning: No virtual environment found for $tool_name"
            print_color "$YELLOW" "  Consider running: cd $tool_dir && python -m venv venv && source venv/bin/activate && pip install -r requirements.txt"
        fi
        
        # Tool-specific environment variables
        case $tool_name in
            fetch)
                add_tool "$tool_name" "$PYTHON_CMD" "$full_path" \
                    "MCP_FETCH_TIMEOUT=${MCP_FETCH_TIMEOUT:-30}" \
                    "MCP_FETCH_MAX_RETRIES=${MCP_FETCH_MAX_RETRIES:-3}"
                ;;
            ui-browser)
                add_tool "$tool_name" "$PYTHON_CMD" "$full_path" \
                    "MCP_UI_BROWSER_HEADLESS=${MCP_UI_BROWSER_HEADLESS:-true}"
                ;;
            git)
                add_tool "$tool_name" "$PYTHON_CMD" "$full_path" \
                    "MCP_GIT_ALLOWED_REPOS=${MCP_GIT_ALLOWED_REPOS:-./}"
                ;;
            *)
                add_tool "$tool_name" "$PYTHON_CMD" "$full_path"
                ;;
        esac
    done
fi

# TypeScript tools setup
if [ -z "$NODE_MISSING" ]; then
    print_header "Setting Up TypeScript Tools"
    
    # TypeScript tools configuration
    declare -A TS_TOOLS=(
        ["memory"]="memory"
        ["filesystem"]="filesystem"
        ["sequential-thinking"]="sequential-thinking"
        ["github"]="github"
        ["react-assistant"]="react-assistant"
        ["rest-api-tester"]="rest-api-tester"
    )
    
    for tool_name in "${!TS_TOOLS[@]}"; do
        tool_dir="${TS_TOOLS[$tool_name]}"
        full_dir="$MCP_TOOLS_PATH/$tool_dir"
        
        if [ -d "$full_dir" ]; then
            # Check if tool needs building
            if [ "$BUILD_TS_TOOLS" = true ] || [ ! -f "$full_dir/dist/index.js" ]; then
                print_color "$YELLOW" "Building $tool_name..."
                (
                    cd "$full_dir"
                    if [ -f "package.json" ]; then
                        npm install >/dev/null 2>&1
                        npm run build >/dev/null 2>&1
                        print_color "$GREEN" "  ✓ $tool_name built successfully"
                    else
                        print_color "$RED" "  ✗ No package.json found for $tool_name"
                        FAILED_TOOLS+=("$tool_name (no package.json)")
                        continue
                    fi
                ) || {
                    print_color "$RED" "  ✗ Failed to build $tool_name"
                    FAILED_TOOLS+=("$tool_name (build failed)")
                    continue
                }
            fi
            
            # Tool-specific environment variables
            case $tool_name in
                memory)
                    add_tool "$tool_name" "node" "$full_dir/dist/index.js" \
                        "MCP_MEMORY_DB_PATH=${MCP_MEMORY_DB_PATH:-./.mcp-data/memory.db}" \
                        "MCP_MEMORY_MAX_ENTITIES=${MCP_MEMORY_MAX_ENTITIES:-10000}"
                    ;;
                filesystem)
                    add_tool "$tool_name" "node" "$full_dir/dist/index.js" \
                        "MCP_FILESYSTEM_ALLOWED_DIRS=${MCP_FILESYSTEM_ALLOWED_DIRS:-./}"
                    ;;
                sequential-thinking)
                    add_tool "$tool_name" "node" "$full_dir/dist/index.js" \
                        "MCP_SEQUENTIAL_THINKING_STORAGE_PATH=${MCP_SEQUENTIAL_THINKING_STORAGE_PATH:-./.mcp-data/thinking}"
                    ;;
                *)
                    add_tool "$tool_name" "node" "$full_dir/dist/index.js"
                    ;;
            esac
        else
            print_color "$RED" "  ✗ Directory not found: $full_dir"
            FAILED_TOOLS+=("$tool_name (directory not found)")
        fi
    done
fi

# Verify installation
print_header "Verifying Installation"

# Get list of installed tools
INSTALLED_TOOLS=$(claude mcp list 2>/dev/null | grep -E "^\s+" | sed 's/^[[:space:]]*//' | cut -d' ' -f1)

if [ -n "$INSTALLED_TOOLS" ]; then
    print_color "$GREEN" "Installed MCP Tools:"
    echo "$INSTALLED_TOOLS" | while read -r tool; do
        print_color "$GREEN" "  ✓ $tool"
    done
else
    print_color "$YELLOW" "No tools currently installed"
fi

# Summary
print_header "Setup Summary"

if [ ${#SUCCESSFUL_TOOLS[@]} -gt 0 ]; then
    print_color "$GREEN" "Successfully installed (${#SUCCESSFUL_TOOLS[@]} tools):"
    for tool in "${SUCCESSFUL_TOOLS[@]}"; do
        print_color "$GREEN" "  ✓ $tool"
    done
fi

if [ ${#FAILED_TOOLS[@]} -gt 0 ]; then
    print_color "$RED" "Failed to install (${#FAILED_TOOLS[@]} tools):"
    for tool in "${FAILED_TOOLS[@]}"; do
        print_color "$RED" "  ✗ $tool"
    done
fi

# Create project configuration template
print_header "Creating Project Configuration"

PROJECT_CONFIG_DIR=".mcp-configs"
if [ ! -d "$PROJECT_CONFIG_DIR" ]; then
    mkdir -p "$PROJECT_CONFIG_DIR"
    print_color "$GREEN" "✓ Created $PROJECT_CONFIG_DIR directory"
fi

# Create example environment file
cat > "$PROJECT_CONFIG_DIR/example.env" << 'EOF'
# MCP Tools Environment Variables
# Copy this file to .env and customize for your project

# Fetch Tool
MCP_FETCH_TIMEOUT=30
MCP_FETCH_MAX_RETRIES=3
MCP_FETCH_USER_AGENT="MyProject/1.0"

# Memory Tool
MCP_MEMORY_DB_PATH="./.mcp-data/memory.db"
MCP_MEMORY_MAX_ENTITIES=10000

# Filesystem Tool
MCP_FILESYSTEM_ALLOWED_DIRS="./"
MCP_FILESYSTEM_MAX_FILE_SIZE=10485760

# UI Browser Tool
MCP_UI_BROWSER_HEADLESS=true
MCP_UI_BROWSER_SCREENSHOT_DIR="./screenshots"

# Git Tool
MCP_GIT_ALLOWED_REPOS="./"
MCP_GIT_MAX_COMMITS=100

# Sequential Thinking Tool
MCP_SEQUENTIAL_THINKING_STORAGE_PATH="./.mcp-data/thinking"
MCP_SEQUENTIAL_THINKING_MAX_THINKING_STEPS=25
EOF

print_color "$GREEN" "✓ Created example environment file: $PROJECT_CONFIG_DIR/example.env"

# Create tool test script
cat > "$PROJECT_CONFIG_DIR/test-tools.sh" << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash

# Test script for MCP Tools

echo "Testing MCP Tools installation..."
echo ""

# Function to test if a tool is available
test_tool() {
    local tool_name=$1
    echo -n "Testing $tool_name... "
    
    if claude mcp list 2>/dev/null | grep -q "$tool_name"; then
        echo "✓ Available"
        return 0
    else
        echo "✗ Not found"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Test each tool
TOOLS=(fetch memory filesystem git ui-browser sequential-thinking github react-assistant rest-api-tester grafana redis)

success=0
failed=0

for tool in "${TOOLS[@]}"; do
    if test_tool "$tool"; then
        ((success++))
    else
        ((failed++))
    fi
done

echo ""
echo "Summary: $success available, $failed not found"

if [ $failed -eq 0 ]; then
    echo "All tools are properly configured!"
    exit 0
else
    echo "Some tools are missing. Run setup-claude-code-cli.sh to install them."
    exit 1
fi
EOF

chmod +x "$PROJECT_CONFIG_DIR/test-tools.sh"
print_color "$GREEN" "✓ Created test script: $PROJECT_CONFIG_DIR/test-tools.sh"

# Final instructions
print_header "Next Steps"

print_color "$BLUE" "1. Test your installation:"
print_color "$NC" "   claude mcp list"
print_color "$NC" "   ./$PROJECT_CONFIG_DIR/test-tools.sh"

print_color "$BLUE" "2. Start using Claude Code with MCP tools:"
print_color "$NC" "   claude code"

print_color "$BLUE" "3. Customize environment variables:"
print_color "$NC" "   cp $PROJECT_CONFIG_DIR/example.env .env"
print_color "$NC" "   # Edit .env with your settings"
print_color "$NC" "   source .env"

print_color "$BLUE" "4. For project-specific configuration:"
print_color "$NC" "   # Create .mcp-*.json files in your project root"
print_color "$NC" "   # See docs/guides/claude_code_cli_setup.md for details"

if [ ${#FAILED_TOOLS[@]} -gt 0 ]; then
    echo ""
    print_color "$YELLOW" "⚠ Some tools failed to install. Please check the errors above and:"
    print_color "$NC" "  - Ensure all dependencies are installed"
    print_color "$NC" "  - Check file paths are correct"
    print_color "$NC" "  - Try running with --build flag to rebuild TypeScript tools"
fi

echo ""
print_color "$GREEN" "Setup complete! Happy coding with Claude Code CLI and MCP Tools! 🚀"

## Plan: Add MCP Tools (memory, filesystem, fetch) to Claude Code CLI

### Overview
I'll set up three essential MCP tools for your Claude Code CLI environment:
1. **Memory** - Knowledge graph for persistent memory across sessions
2. **Filesystem** - Secure file operations with configurable access control  
3. **Fetch** - Web content fetching and conversion capabilities

### Step 1: Prepare MCP Tools
- Navigate to `/home/hd/Desktop/LAB/MCP_Tools/`
- Install dependencies for Python tools (fetch)
- Build TypeScript tools (memory, filesystem)

### Step 2: Build TypeScript Tools
```bash
# Build memory tool
cd /home/hd/Desktop/LAB/MCP_Tools/memory
npm install
npm run build

# Build filesystem tool  
cd /home/hd/Desktop/LAB/MCP_Tools/filesystem
npm install
npm run build
```

### Step 3: Setup Python Tool
```bash
# Setup fetch tool
cd /home/hd/Desktop/LAB/MCP_Tools/fetch
python3 -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate
pip install -r requirements.txt
deactivate
```

### Step 4: Add Tools to Claude Code CLI
```bash
# Add memory tool (TypeScript)
claude mcp add memory node /home/hd/Desktop/LAB/MCP_Tools/memory/dist/index.js

# Add filesystem tool (TypeScript)
claude mcp add filesystem node /home/hd/Desktop/LAB/MCP_Tools/filesystem/dist/index.js

# Add fetch tool (Python)
claude mcp add fetch python /home/hd/Desktop/LAB/MCP_Tools/fetch/server.py
```

### Step 5: Create Project Configuration
- Create `.mcp-configs` directory in Dev-Agency
- Setup environment variables for each tool
- Create configuration files for project-specific settings

### Step 6: Test Installation
- Verify tools are available with `claude mcp list`
- Test each tool's basic functionality
- Create a test script for quick validation

```bash
# Memory tool
MCP_MEMORY_DB_PATH="/home/hd/Desktop/LAB/Dev-Agency/.mcp-data/memory.db"
MCP_MEMORY_MAX_ENTITIES=10000

MCP_FILESYSTEM_MAX_FILE_SIZE=10485760

# Fetch tool

MCP_FETCH_MAX_RETRIES=3
```

After completion, you'll be able to:
- Use memory tool to track code relationships and project knowledge
- Use filesystem tool for secure file operations
- Use fetch tool to retrieve web content
- Access all tools directly from Claude Code CLI sessions

#!/bin/bash

# MCP Tools Test Script for Dev-Agency
# Generated: 08-09-2025

echo "============================================"
echo "Testing MCP Tools Installation"
echo "============================================"
echo ""

# Colors for output
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Function to test if a tool is available
test_tool() {
    local tool_name=$1
    echo -n "Testing $tool_name... "
    
    if claude mcp list 2>/dev/null | grep -q "$tool_name"; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}✓ Available${NC}"
        return 0
    else
        echo -e "${RED}✗ Not found${NC}"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Test core tools
echo "Core MCP Tools:"
echo "---------------"
test_tool "memory"
test_tool "filesystem"
test_tool "fetch"
echo ""

# Test configuration files
echo "Configuration Files:"
echo "-------------------"

test_config() {
    local file=$1
    local name=$2
    if [ -f "$file" ]; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}✓ $name exists${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${RED}✗ $name missing${NC}"
    fi
}

test_config ".mcp-memory.json" "Memory config"
test_config ".mcp-filesystem.json" "Filesystem config"
test_config ".mcp-fetch.json" "Fetch config"
test_config ".mcp-configs/project.env" "Environment variables"
echo ""

# Test data directories
echo "Data Directories:"
echo "----------------"

test_dir() {
    local dir=$1
    local name=$2
    if [ -d "$dir" ]; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}✓ $name exists${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${RED}✗ $name missing${NC}"
    fi
}

test_dir ".mcp-data" "Data root"
test_dir ".mcp-data/memory" "Memory data"
test_dir ".mcp-data/thinking" "Thinking data"
test_dir ".mcp-data/cache" "Cache"
echo ""

# Summary
echo "============================================"
echo "Test Summary"
echo "============================================"

# Count available tools
available_count=$(claude mcp list 2>/dev/null | grep -c -E "^\s+(memory|filesystem|fetch)")

if [ "$available_count" -eq 3 ]; then
    echo -e "${GREEN}✓ All 3 core tools are properly configured!${NC}"
    echo ""
    echo "You can now use these tools in Claude Code CLI:"
    echo "  - memory: Knowledge graph for persistent memory"
    echo "  - filesystem: Secure file operations"
    echo "  - fetch: Web content fetching and conversion"
    echo ""
    echo "To start using them, run: claude code"
    exit 0
else
    echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠ Only $available_count of 3 tools are configured${NC}"
    echo ""
    echo "To see available tools: claude mcp list"
    echo "To add missing tools, check the setup instructions."
    exit 1
fi

content.text: Finally, let's create a quick usage guide:

input.content:
# MCP Tools Usage Guide for Dev-Agency

## Installation Status ✅

The following MCP tools have been successfully installed and configured:

1. **Memory** - Knowledge graph for persistent memory
2. **Filesystem** - Secure file operations  
3. **Fetch** - Web content fetching and conversion

## Quick Start

### Start Claude Code with MCP Tools
```bash
claude code
```

Once in a Claude Code session, the tools are automatically available.

## Available Tools & Commands

### Memory Tool
Store and retrieve persistent knowledge across sessions:

- **Create entities**: Store information about code, projects, or concepts
- **Create relations**: Link entities together (e.g., "function uses library")
- **Search nodes**: Find stored information by query
- **Read graph**: View the entire knowledge graph

Example usage in Claude Code:
```
"Store this information: The Dev-Agency project uses MCP tools for enhanced development"
"What do you remember about Dev-Agency?"
```

### Filesystem Tool
Secure file operations within the project:

- **read_file**: Read file contents
- **write_file**: Create or overwrite files
- **edit_file**: Replace content in files
- **list_directory**: Browse directories
- **search_files**: Find files by pattern

The tool is configured to work within: `/home/hd/Desktop/LAB/Dev-Agency`

### Fetch Tool
Retrieve and process web content:

- **fetch**: Get content from a URL (converts to markdown by default)
- **fetch_batch**: Fetch multiple URLs concurrently
- **extract_links**: Extract all links from a webpage

Example usage:
```
"Fetch the content from https://example.com"
"Get the latest documentation from [URL]"
```

## Configuration Files

All configurations are stored in project-specific files:

- `.mcp-memory.json` - Memory tool settings
- `.mcp-filesystem.json` - Filesystem access control
- `.mcp-fetch.json` - Fetch tool settings
- `.mcp-configs/project.env` - Environment variables

## Data Storage

MCP tools store data in:
```
.mcp-data/
├── memory/      # Knowledge graph data
├── thinking/    # Sequential thinking chains
└── cache/       # Tool caches
```

## Testing Installation

Run the test script to verify everything is working:
```bash
./.mcp-configs/test-mcp-tools.sh
```

## Viewing Available Tools

Check which MCP tools are available:
```bash
claude mcp list
```

## Troubleshooting

### Tool not connecting
1. Check the tool's dependencies are installed
2. For Python tools, ensure virtual environment is activated
3. For TypeScript tools, ensure they're built (`npm run build`)

### Permission issues
```bash
chmod +x /path/to/server.py  # For Python tools
chmod +x /path/to/dist/index.js  # For TypeScript tools
```

### Reconfigure a tool
```bash
claude mcp remove <tool-name>
claude mcp add <tool-name> <command> <path>
```

## Environment Variables

To use custom settings, source the project environment:
```bash
source .mcp-configs/project.env
```

## Next Steps

1. Start using the tools in Claude Code sessions
2. The memory tool will build a knowledge graph of your project over time
3. Use filesystem tool for safe file operations
4. Use fetch tool to retrieve documentation or web resources

## Tips

- The memory tool persists across sessions - use it to track important project information
- The filesystem tool respects the configured boundaries - it won't access files outside the allowed directories
- The fetch tool can convert web pages to markdown for easier processing

---
